definitions.definition: to a position in or inside something

examples.text: He threw the letter into the fire.
She turned and walked off into the night.
Driving into the sun, we had to shade our eyes.

definitions.definition: to a point at which you hit somebody/something

examples.text: The truck crashed into a parked car.

definitions.definition: to a point during a period of time

examples.text: She carried on working late into the night.
He didn't get married until he was well into his forties.

definitions.definition: used to show a change in state

examples.text: The fruit can be made into jam.
Can you translate this passage into German?

definitions.definition: used to show the result of an action

examples.text: He was shocked into a confession of guilt.

definitions.definition: about or in connection with something
used when you are dividing numbers
to be interested in something in an active way

examples.text: He's into surfing in a big way.

definitions.definition: to owe somebody money or be owed money by somebody

examples.text: By the time he'd fixed the leak, I was into him for $500.
The bank was into her for $100 000.
